detaileddescription.para:
Handle the drawing related tasks of the calendars
calendar
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Signal function of the calendar
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

It will check if the days part of calendar is touched and if it is, it will calculate the day and put it in pressed_date of calendar object.
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer
to a point
true: days part of calendar is touched and its related date is put in pressed date false: the point is out of days part area.

Get the height of a calendar's header based on it's style
calendar
point to a calendar
the header's height

Get the height of a calendar's day_names based on it's style
calendar
point to a calendar
the day_names's height

Draw the calendar header with month name and arrows
calendar
point to a calendar
mask
a mask for drawing

Draw the day's name below the header
calendar
point to a calendar
mask
a mask for drawing

Draw the date numbers in a matrix
calendar
point to a calendar
mask
a mask for drawing

Get the day of the week
year
a year
month
a month
day
a day
[0..6] which means [Sun..Sat]

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *calendar, int32_t year, int32_t month, int32_t day)
memberdef.name: is_highlighted

detaileddescription.para:
Check weather a date is highlighted or not
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
year
a year
month
a month [1..12]
day
a day [1..31]
true: highlighted

Get the day name
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
day
a day in [0..6]

Get the month name
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
month
a month. The range is basically [1..12] but [-11..1] is also supported to handle previous year

Get the number of days in a month
year
a year
month
a month. The range is basically [1..12] but [-11..1] is also supported to handle previous year
[28..31]

Tells whether a year is leap year or not
year
a year
0: not leap year; 1: leap year

Create a calendar object
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new calendar
copy
pointer to a calendar object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created calendar

Set the today's date
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
today
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t variable containing the date of today. The value will be saved it can be local variable too.

Set the currently showed
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
showed
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t variable containing the date to show. The value will be saved it can be local variable too.

Set the the highlighted dates
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
highlighted
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t array containing the dates. ONLY A POINTER WILL BE SAVED! CAN'T BE LOCAL ARRAY.
date_num
number of dates in the array

Set the name of the days
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
day_names
pointer to an array with the names. E.g. const char * days[7] = {"Sun", "Mon", ...} Only the pointer will be saved so this variable can't be local which will be destroyed later.

Set the name of the month
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
day_names
pointer to an array with the names. E.g. const char * days[12] = {"Jan", "Feb", ...} Only the pointer will be saved so this variable can't be local which will be destroyed later.

Set a style of a calendar.
calendar
pointer to calendar object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Get the today's date
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
return pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t variable containing the date of today.

Get the currently showed
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t variable containing the date is being shown.

Get the the pressed date.
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t variable containing the pressed date.

Get the the highlighted dates
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer to an lv_calendar_date_t array containing the dates.

Get the number of the highlighted dates
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
number of highlighted days

Get the name of the days
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer to the array of day names

Get the name of the month
calendar
pointer to a calendar object
pointer to the array of month names

Get style of a calendar.
calendar
pointer to calendar object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to the style
